Entries.Text: This is the place. Our suspect should be in this apartment building.

<0i>We look around the cozy-looking interior. 
I can see the doors to our suspect's apartment.</0i>
<0i>Before doing anything, I turn to Mr. Spots and ask him about his brother. </0i>
<0i>For a moment he loses his usual cool.</0i>
I appreciate Your curiosity. It's very welcomed in this profession.
But timing too.
<0i>As he goes along the hallway, I feel the heavy paw on my arm.</0i>

Don't take it personally, kid. 
He never talks about it.
His brother was lost at sea almost a decade ago, that's all You need to know.
<0i>I catch up with Mr. Spots at our suspect doors and I knock few times, encouraged by his enabling gaze.</0i>
<0i>There's a grave silence on the other side. Seems no one's home.</0i>
<0i>I take few steps back and launch myself at the door, to no avail.</0i>
<0i>It hurts, but not as much as the detective's disappointed look.</0i>

<0i>I knock on the nearest doors on my left, but no one replies.
As I'm about to knock on a door on the right, they open slightly.</0i>
<0i>I can't see who's on the other side and I can barely hear the whisper coming from far back.</0i>
Yes... what is it?
<0i>I ask about our suspect, but before I can even finish the sentence, the door closes shut.</0i>
It's not my business! I don't care what he does in his apartment and this damn basement!
<0i>I knock again and someone replies in a way that suggests the conversation is over.</0i>
That seems like a good idea.
<0i>There's a board near the entrance, containing all the information about the building, upcoming repairs, and even some highly enthusiastic encouragements to pay the rent on time.</0i>
<0i>There's also a neatly-written card saying „SAJ BUZZ – Landlord” and a number of the apartment he resides in.</0i>
<0i>We find the place and I gently knock on the doors. Soon they open and we see a cheerful-looking fox, smiling at us playfully.</0i>

Oh dear! Did not expected any visitors today. 
Welcome to my wonderful tenement!
<0i>I'm so surprised by his optimistic attitude. Such a nice lad!</0i>
<0i>I ask him about the secret of his attitude</0i>
Oh it's quite simple. For many years I worked very hard, trying to get my business up and running.
Many times I've felt like this is futile and I'm gonna be left with nothing.
But I've kept working, I've kept pursuing my dreams.
And I've made some risky decisions. These were tough times.
But it paid off!
Now I'm not only a successful businessman, but also a landlord in the building owned by me, living the best life and enjoying what I do for a living!
You just can't stop smiling when You know You're living the dream!
<0i>I keep thinking about all the years I've wasted on law school and endless hours in our family law firm.</0i>
<0i>It seemed like something that was expected of me and safe. But it just made me feel more and more trapped in a passionless life.</0i>
<0i>Funny, it's being one day and being here, talking with all these new amazing animals, made me feel unusually enthused.</0i>
<0i>I feel like I've awakened from a very long slumber doing something I'm enjoying wholeheartedly.</0i>
<0i>I ask him about the mysterious man that lives in the building.</0i>
Oh, that man... He is very mysterious.
He calls himself Chester, but I've always had a weird feeling it's not his real name... he barely even reacted to it!
But he pays rent on time... or at least did, until recently.

Options.Name: When was the last time You've seen him?

Entries.Text: The rent was due last week. I decided to make sure if he's ok, but the apartment was empty like he moved out...
I think it was last week. He was leaving the basement.
Of course, this way.
<0i>Saj leads us to the apartment, but as we enter it becomes quite obvious there's nothing here.</0i>

Options.Name: When was the last time You've seen him?

Entries.Text: <0i>Empty walls and dusty floor – and that's about it.</0i>
<0i>I look around the apartment. It's small but cozy. Someone lived here in very modest conditions, there's no sign of any furniture...</0i>
<0i>Saj thinks for a moment.</0i>
I believe it was last week. He was coming from the basement and seemed very occupied.
<0i>We leave the apartment and Saj closes the door.</0i>
Does each tenant have their basement? Can we see one that belongs to our suspect?
I'm not sure. I should have some spare keys, but... please, wait a moment.
<0i>He comes back with the box of keys, some of them broken.</0i>
I tend to keep them, just in case. The key to his basement should be there.
I am pretty sure it's one of the broken ones, but it's missing the upper half.
None
<0i>We take the broken key and go down to the basement. I open the doors and I take a step with unease...</0i>
<0i>… The basement is dark and cold, the light doesn't work.</0i>
You are supposed to be a detective, a bad time for cold feet!
<0i>As I walk down, I notice some pieces of paper scattered on the floor.</0i>
<0i>As I walk down, I notice some pieces of paper scattered on the floor.</0i>

<0i>I take a closer look. 
These are the notes from the museum! Someone left them here in a hurry.</0i>
<0i>Most of them are badly damaged, the frail trail of burned paper still in the air.</0i>
<0i>I gather all the notes I can see.</0i>
<0i>As I look further, all I can see are some boxes full of books, most of them badly damaged by the weather, but someone was too fond of them to throw'em away.</0i>
<0i>I can see why; they're amazing! I can even recall some titles about history and archeology.</0i>
<0i>There's also a desk in the corner with a little kerosene lamp, but there's nothing but torn and burnt paper and spilled ink.</0i>
<0i>As I look closer, however, I can see a pile of books underneath. These are the missing books from the library!</0i>
<0i>I collect them intending to return them to Miss Nake.</0i>
<0i>Mr. Spots carefully reads whatever remained of the notes. Poor Dr. Bearson and hours of work wasted!</0i>
<0i>Hmmm... I see... Henry, take a look at this.</0i>
Hmmm... I see... Henry, take a look at this.
Hmmm, that's interesting indeed. Supposedly, the Jewel according to the legend was some sort of the key and was used to seal Meerkate's tomb...

I believe our culprit wants to open the secret chamber and get all the gold.
We cannot let it happen.
We won't. We need to get to Meerkate's Tomb as soon as possible! We can use my contacts in the military...
<0i>Wait... is this really happening?!</0i>
